meanings.definition: A right or privilege of holding a court or jurisdiction within a specified area.
meanings.sent1: The soke of the local court allowed him to make decisions.
meanings.sent2: The king granted the soke to the noble family to administer justice.
meanings.sent3: The soke of the playground was fiercely contested by the children.
meanings.sent4: Her soke over the debate club made her the ultimate decision-maker.
meanings.sent5: The soke of the library gave him the power to organize events.

meanings.definition: To assert or maintain a right or claim.
meanings.sent1: He had to soke his ownership of the land in court.
meanings.sent2: She soke her innocence in front of the jury.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to soke its territory by marking everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer had to soke his client's rights vigorously.
meanings.sent5: The student had to soke his position on the project deadline.

meanings.sent1: She decided to soke advice from her mentor.
meanings.sent2: He needed to soke permission to enter the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to soke nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The explorer had to soke supplies for the long journey.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to soke clues to solve the mystery.
